title: Boris Johnson Clings On to Prime Minister Role as More U.K. Lawmakers Quit Government
sub_head: Embattled leader tries to ride out revolt by party lawmakers and a push by some members of his cabinet to have him resign
body:
LONDON—British Prime Minister Boris Johnson clung to power in Downing Street on Wednesday evening, refusing to quit following an extraordinary standoff with his Conservative Party that saw a wave of ministers resign and members of his own cabinet implore him to step aside.
In a frenetic day in Britain’s Parliament, Mr. Johnson sought to ride out a rebellion as a long line of Conservative Party lawmakers stated they no longer had confidence in the prime minister following a series of scandals and questions about the British leader’s integrity.
